alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Middlesex; New Kent; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 1:19PM EDT until July 16 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Virginia, eastern Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in east central Virginia, King William, King and Queen and New Kent. In eastern Virginia, Middlesex. In southeast Virginia, Gloucester, James City and York. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gloucester Courthouse, West Point, Urbanna, Norge, Toano, Shacklefords, Glenns, Saluda, Barhamsville, Little Plymouth, Gressit, Adner, Clancie, Pampa, York River State Park, Mattaponi, Holly Forks, Allmondsville, Christensons Corner and Ark. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
